p: A. vera anti-HSV-1 activity was also assessed and confirmed in a 2016 study by Rezazadeh and colleagues [ 24]. A preparation of A. vera gel showed significant (0.2-5%) inhibition of herpes simplex virus-1 cells isolated from the lip lesions of a patient and grown cell culture (Vero cells) [ 24]. A. vera was also shown to inhibit HSV-2 attachment and post-attachment processes, and entry into Vero cells [ 25].
